title: Can I become a K-pop trainee if I can’t dance, but I can sing? - Quora

response.answer_text: If you can show your worth as a singer, you have a good shot. Be aware though, if they know you ‘can’t dance’ then they will drill you on it and give you hell about it until you can. You’ll need to work extra hours outside of dance class working on improving your dance all the while making sure your vocals are still there. If you still can’t dance by the time evaluations come, unless you have a god-like singing voice that makes up for your lack of dance (or they see potential to have you as a kind of IU type solo idol that doesn’t do hard dances), you’ll be cut.

The other answers said it all but I like to add that it depends on what company you audition for like SM doesn't care if you have a nice voice you're in their motto is we can build talent and they've proven it. A lot of SM artists couldn't dance when they auditioned but with training became some of the best, take Taeyong from NCT for example he was awful at dancing to the point that the SM dance coach told him he's hopeless and should give up but he powered through and now he's one if the best dancers in kpop praised by other idols ,dance trainers and choreographers, but you should keep in mind that it won't be an easy road at all.

If you’re auditioning at a company and they want to see more of you, they will ask you to dance. Most likely a prepared dance and a freestyle. They look for rythym and potential so try working on it if they ask you for a callback.
